title: Firefly aims for orbit on second demonstration flight
summary: With the goal of successfully reaching orbit, Firefly is set to launch FLTA002 – its second demonstration flight of the Alpha launch vehicle – on the mission dubbed “To The Black.” Launching from Space Launch Complex 2 West (SLC-2W) at the Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, the vehicle is scheduled to lift off on Sunday, Sept. 11 at 3:00 PM PDT (22:00 UTC). In the event of a delay, the launch window extends to 7:00 PM PDT (02:00 UTC on Sept. 12).

title: Starlink keeps this former Tesla employee online in the desert
summary: Starlink is keeping everyone connected, including a former Tesla employee who went viral on TikTok for his dome in the desert. While...

title: This should be the absolute peak of hurricane season—but it’s dead quiet out there
summary: Seasonal activity is running 50 percent below normal levels.

title: CAPSTONE enters safe mode during trajectory correction maneuver
summary: A NASA-funded cubesat mission to the moon has gone into safe mode after suffering a problem during a trajectory correction maneuver, the agency said Sept. 10.

title: SpaceX ramps hiring for T-Mobile Starlink cell service partnership
summary: SpaceX is ramping hiring efforts for its T-Mobile Starlink cell service partnership. Last month, SpaceX and T-Mobile announced their new partnership to...

title: Watch live: Falcon 9 test-firing imminent at Cape Canaveral
summary: SpaceX is counting down to a static fire test of a Falcon 9 rocket on pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. The test-firing of the booster’s nine engines is in preparation for a launch with 54 more Starlink internet satellites as soon as Sunday night.

title: SpaceX launches Starlink 4-2 mission with BlueWalker 3 rideshare
summary: SpaceX launched the Starlink 4-2 rideshare mission on Saturday, September 10, 2022, at 9:20 PM EDT (01:20 UTC on September 11) from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida. Onboard Falcon 9 were 34 SpaceX Starlink satellites and the BlueWalker 3 prototype satellite for AST SpaceMobile’s cellular broadband constellation.

title: Sierra Space and U.S. military to explore using Dream Chaser for point-to-point cargo delivery
summary: Sierra Space signed an agreement with the U.S. Transportation Command to explore using Dream Chaser for point-to-point delivery of military cargo

title: SpaceX planning next two Falcon 9 launches in Florida
summary: The 39th and 40th launches of the year from Florida’s Space Coast are set to blast off Saturday night and Sunday night, back-to-back missions to deploy more satellites for SpaceX’s Starlink internet network.

title: SciTec wins $272 million Space Force contract for data analytics software
summary: SciTec, a small business based in Princeton, New Jersey, won a $272 million contract to develop software to analyze data collected by the U.S. military’s early-warning infrared satellites.
